str2: (a) there, yonder, in that place, (b) thither, there. Of uncertain affinity; there; by extension, thither.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A mountain, hill. Probably from an obsolete oro; a mountain: -hill, mount(-ain).
From hiko; competent, i.e. Ample or fit.
A flock, herd. From ago; a drove.
A swine, hog, sow. Of uncertain derivation; a hog.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Nominative Feminine Singular
str2: To feed, pasture. A prolonged form of a primary verb; to pasture; by extension to, fodder; reflexively, to graze.
And, even, also, namely.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: From para and kaleo; to call near, i.e. Invite, invoke.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
In order that, so that. Probably from the same as the former part of heautou; in order that.

parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To turn to, commit, entrust; I allow, yield, permit. From epi and the base of trope; to turn over, i.e. Allow.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative Neuter 3rd Person Plural
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
To go in, come in, enter. From eis and erchomai; to enter.
That, that one there, yonder. From ekei; that one (neuter) thing); often intensified by the article prefixed.
And, even, also, namely.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To turn to, commit, entrust; I allow, yield, permit. From epi and the base of trope; to turn over, i.e. Allow.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative Neuter 3rd Person Plural
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
